intro: Odontonema breedlovei, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange inflorescences that resemble misty clouds. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in clusters, producing a striking visual effect, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens. Odontonema breedlovei thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
